<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check if we can lower this to a native operation.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Try to lower to a SET&#42; instruction:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SET&#42; can match the following patterns:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// select&#95;cc f32, f32, -1,  0, cc&#95;supported</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// select&#95;cc f32, f32, 1.0f, 0.0f, cc&#95;supported</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// select&#95;cc i32, i32, -1,  0, cc&#95;supported</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Move hardware True/False values to the correct operand.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1372"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// expanded by the DAG Legalizer. This is not the case for ISD::LOAD, so we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1373"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// need to manually expand loads that may be legal in some address spaces and</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01375" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1375"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// compute shaders, since the data is sign extended when it is uploaded to the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01376" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1376"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// buffer. However SEXT loads from other address spaces are not supported, so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01377" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1377"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we need to expand them here.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1687"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (((512 + (kc&#95;bank &lt;&lt; 12) + const&#95;index) &lt;&lt; 2) + chan)</span></CodeLine>
